thread.title: Girls soccer: Notre Dame tops Bangor in Pink Out game
thread.title_full: Girls soccer: Notre Dame tops Bangor in Pink Out game

title: Girls soccer: Notre Dame tops Bangor in Pink Out game
text:
Complete Box Score Â» 
Notre Dame beat Bangor 4-0 in Colonial League action Thursday, but the numbers they put up off the field were more noteworthy. 
The teams played in a Pink Out game on behalf of Breast Cancer Awareness month and to support local patients and their families being cared for at St. Luke's. The Crusaders so far have raised $2,900 for the cause after raising $1,100 in 2013 and $2,000 in 2014. 
The field at Notre Dame was lined in pink with a cancer ribbon painted in the center circle. 
Mikayla Bates scored a pair of goals for the Crusaders while M'Kenna Murphy kept the shutout in net.
